briefdescription.para: The remote user did not accept the file within the timeout period.
The file transfer connection is open and data will be sent or received.
The file transfer was interrupted and did not complete.
The file transfer was successful.
How much of the file has been sent or received so far.
A unique identifier for this session.

detaileddescription.para: Uses the TCP/IP port prefixed by an 'S' if this session is serving the file or a 'C' if this session is receiving the file.

briefdescription.para: The DccUserInfo object associated with this DccFileSession.
The DccFileInfo object associated with this DccFileSession.
The information about the remote user.

detaileddescription.para: A read only instance of DccUserInfo.

memberdef.argsstring: (DccUserInfo dccUserInfo, DccFileInfo dccFileInfo, int bufferSize, int listenPort, string sessionID)
memberdef.name: DccFileSession

briefdescription.para: Prepare a new instance with default values but do not connect to another user.
Attempt to shut the session down correctly.
Called by DccListener when it receives a DCC Accept message.
A DCC Send request has already been sent and the remote user has responded with a Resume request.

parameterdescription.para: The number of bytes the remote user already has..
If the session is no longer active or the file resume position was larger than the file.

briefdescription.para: Called when there has been no activity is a session for the the length of the timeout period.
Non synchro version of Stop() for internal use.
The file transfer is done. So close everything cleanly.
Stop the file transfer.
Summary information about this session.

simplesect.para: Simple information about this session in human readable format.

memberdef.argsstring: (Connection connection, string nick, string fileName, bool turbo)
memberdef.name: Get

briefdescription.para: Ask a remote user to send a file. The remote user may or may not respond and there is no fixed time within which he must respond. A response will come in the form of a DCC Send request.

parameterdescription.para: The connection the remotes user is on.
Who to send the request to.
The name of the file to have sent. This should not contain any spaces.
True to use send-ahead mode for transfers.

memberdef.argsstring: (DccUserInfo dccUserInfo, string listenIPAddress, int listenPort, DccFileInfo dccFileInfo, int bufferSize, bool turbo)
memberdef.name: Send

briefdescription.para: Attempt to send a file to a remote user. Start listening on the given port and address. If the remote user does not accept the offer within the timeout period the the session will be closed.

detaileddescription.para: This method should be called from within a try/catch block in case there are socket errors. This methods will also automatically handle a Resume if the remote client requests it.

parameterdescription.para: The information about the remote user.

The IP address of the local machine in dot quad format (e.g. 192.168.0.25). This is the address that will be sent to the remote user. The IP address of the NAT machine must be used if the client is behind a NAT/Firewall system.
The port that the session will listen on.
The file to be sent. If the file name has spaces in it they will be replaced with underscores when the name is sent.
The size of the send buffer. Generally should be between 4k and 32k.
True to use send-ahead mode for transfers.

simplesect.para: A unique session instance for this file and remote user.

parameterdescription.para: If the listen port is already in use.

briefdescription.para: Another user has offered to send a file. This method should be called to accept the offer and save the file to the give location. The parameters needed to call this method are provided by the OnDccFileTransferRequest() event.

detaileddescription.para: This method should be called from within a try/catch block in case it is unable to connect or there are other socket errors.

parameterdescription.para: The local file that will hold the data being sent. If the file is the result of a previous incomplete download the the attempt will be made to resume where the previous left off.
Will the send ahead protocol be used.

simplesect.para: A unique session instance for this file and remote user.

parameterdescription.para: If the listen port is already in use.

briefdescription.para: Allows the user to send and receive files from other IRC users.
